recursion

Class Recursion

  • java.lang.Object
    • recursion.Recursion

  • public class Recursion
extends java.lang.Object
    Program asks user to choose between three options for problems solved using recursion; reciprical arithmetic, palindrome determination, and finding the greatest common divisor on two input numbers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Recursion()
      Creates GUI for the recursion program.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Sets what happens when the avaliable buttons are pressed or selected.
      static double fractions(int k)
      Looks if the current reciptical and if its even it adds the next function otherwise it subtracts the next function from the sum.
      static double GCD(int m, int n)
      Takes two int values and finds the greatest common divisor of the two int inputs.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static boolean palindrome(java.lang.String b)
      Takes a String from the user and removes any special symbols and whitespace and compares the first and the last letter to find out if the string is the same backwards as it is forward.
      void showFractions()
      Sets what the user sees on the frame when the fraction radio button is selected.
      void showGCD()
      Sets what the user sees on the frame when the GCD radio button is selected.
